key_risks: High client concentration with one client representing 24% of gross accounts receivable
Geopolitical risks due to operations in over 20 locations across 8 countries
Competitive pressures and potential AI-driven disruption in the BPO industry
Reputational risks from content moderation services for social media platforms and dating apps
controversies: Lawsuit (*Lozada v. TaskUs, Inc.*) alleging misleading statements about employee attrition rates and Glassdoor ratings
Labor lawsuit (*Martin Ayala v. TaskUs, Inc.*) highlighting concerns about working conditions and employee treatment
social_issues: Labor controversies and allegations of poor working conditions in offshore delivery centers
High employee attrition rates and concerns about employee well-being
governance_issues: Potential governance issues related to alleged misrepresentations in IPO and secondary offering documents

sources.title: MARTIN AYALA VS TASKUS, INC. - UniCourt
sources.snippet: On 01/03/2019 MARTIN AYALA filed a Labor - Other Labor lawsuit against TASKUS, INC. This case was filed in Los Angeles County Superior Courts, Santa Monica Courthouse located in Los Angeles, California. The Judges overseeing this case are ROBERT B. BROADBELT and SAMANTHA JESSNER. The case status is Other.
